alerts.price-fetch-error: Our pricing provider, CoinGecko, is currently down.
alerts.boostedPools: Increased yields, greater capital efficiency, deeper liquidity. Try Balancer Boosted pools now →
alerts.vebalL2: Staking is live on Polygon and Arbitrum. Incentives for eligible pools will resume on April 28.

apiErrorCodeDetails.DuplicateOrder: There was another identical order already submitted. Please try again.
apiErrorCodeDetails.InsufficientFee: The signed fee is insufficient. It's possible that is higher now due to a change in the gas price, ether price, or the sell token price. Please try again to get an updated fee quote.
apiErrorCodeDetails.InvalidSignature: The order signature is invalid. Check whether your Wallet app supports off-chain signing.
apiErrorCodeDetails.InsufficientValidTo: The order you are signing is already expired. This can happen if you set a short expiration in the settings and waited too long before signing the transaction. Please try again.
apiErrorCodeDetails.InsufficientFunds: The account doesn't have enough funds.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnsupportedToken: One of the tokens you are swapping is unsupported.
apiErrorCodeDetails.WrongOwner:
The signature is invalid.

It's likely that the signing method provided by your wallet doesn't comply with the standards required by Balancer.

Check whether your Wallet app supports off-chain signing (EIP-712 or ETHSIGN).
apiErrorCodeDetails.NotFound: Token pair selected has insufficient liquidity.
apiErrorCodeDetails.OrderNotFound: The order you are trying to cancel does not exist.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnsupportedSellTokenSource: The sell token source is currently not supported.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnsupportedBuyTokenSource: The buy token source is currently not supported.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnhandledGetError: Order fetch failed. This may be due to a server or network connectivity issue. Please try again later.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnhandledCreateError: The order was not accepted by the network.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnhandledDeleteError: The order cancellation was not accepted by the network.
apiErrorCodeDetails.UnhandledError: Something failed. Please try again later.
apiErrorCodeDetails.Error403Accept: The order cannot be accepted. Your account is deny-listed.
apiErrorCodeDetails.Error403Cancel: The order cannot be cancelled. Your account is deny-listed.
apiErrorCodeDetails.Error429Accept: The order cannot be accepted. Too many order placements. Please retry in a minute.
apiErrorCodeDetails.Error429Cancel: The order cannot be cancelled. Too many order cancellations. Please retry in a minute.

approveBatchRelayerTooltip: Your permission is required to use the Batch relayer.

autoOptimiseLiquidityToggle.label: Auto optimize liquidity
autoOptimiseLiquidityToggle.tooltip: Optimise token values automatically to match the token weights you specified.

basedOnTokensInWallet: Based on pool tokens in your wallet
byConnectingWallet: By connecting a wallet, I agree to Balancer Foundation’s

claimHero.title: Claim liquidity incentives
claimHero.description: Balancer Protocol liquidity incentives are directed to pools by veBAL voters. Stake in these pools to earn incentives. Boost with veBAL for up to 2.5x extra on Mainnet pools.

tips.addLiquidity: To earn liquidity mining incentives, add liquidity to eligible pools across Ethereum Mainnet and supported Layer 2's like Polygon and Arbitrum (see the table onthe veBAL page). Note: You'll earn swap fees with or without staking but you don't need to claim these as they are automatically added to your position.
tips.stake: If you've provided liquidity in an eligible pool, you'll have an option to stake your Liquidity Provider (LP) tokens from that pool. Stake them to receive liquidity mining incentives in addition to any swap fees.
tips.boost: Get veBAL to boost your liquidity mining incentives by up to 2.5x (on Ethereum Mainnet only). The more veBAL you hold, the larger your boost. veBAL holders also earn protocol fees and can vote to direct future pool emissions. Note, there is no additional boost from holding veBAL on Layer 2 pools like Polygon and Arbitrum.
tips.claim: Token earnings from liquidity mining accumulate every block and can be claimed at any time. Some pools offer multiple token incentives (not just BAL). Additionally, veBAL holders also get a share of protocol revenue, in both bb-a-USD and BAL.

coingeckoPricingTooltip: The data for this graph is pulled from our pricing provider, CoinGecko.
communitySwapFeeLabel: Delegated swap fees; currently fixed: {0}

copperLaunchPromo.description: Copper is the platform for FLAs—a simple crowdfunding mechanism that enables projects and ideas from across the world to raise money from individuals without barriers to entry.
copperLaunchPromo.poweredByBalancer: Copper is built on Balancer V2 and uses Liquidity Bootstrapping Pools to power its FLAs
copperLaunchPromo.title: A Copper fair launch auction pool (FLA)

correctTokenPricing: Correct token pricing may help you avoid losing money to arbitrageurs. Losses could happen if you don't add pool assets in proportion to their target weights.

createAPool.arbReason: Based on pricing information from CoinGecko, you’re vulnerable to losing funds to arbitraguers since the amounts you’re adding to the pool are not in proportion to the pool weights specified.
createAPool.bestFeeOption: 0.30% is best for most weighted pools with established tokens. Go higher for more exotic tokens.
createAPool.customAddressOption: Allow dynamic fees from an address I choose
createAPool.customAddressInfo: This could be another address you own an address of a smart contract. You can only ever set this once.
createAPool.customAddressTitle: Enter an address which can update fees
createAPool.dynamicFeeRadioLabel: Allow dynamic fees from an address I choose
createAPool.enterTokenPrice: Enter the estimated current price of {0} in $USD
createAPool.existingPoolInfo: There’s already another pool with exactly the same tokens and fee structure. It’s recommended to add your liquidity to the other pool or to go back and change your Pool Creation parameters in a material way to avoid fractured liquidity and lower profits for both pools.
createAPool.fixedFeeRadioLabel: Permanently fix fees to the initial rate
createAPool.governanceFees: Allow Balancer governance to manage fees
createAPool.governanceFeesTooltip: Enable this to give Balancer governance the ability to dynamically manage the fees of this pool in order to maximize profits. But note, Balancer governance is under no obligation to actually manage the fees and will likely only do so if there is significant swap volume.
createAPool.invalidInitialWeightsInfo: One or more tokens has an initial weight less than 1% which may cause funding to fail. If the token has a missing price, enter in a price. Otherwise, adjust the initial balances in the previous step.
createAPool.maxLiquidityTooltip: This is the max amount of liquidity you can provide to the pool with the current token selection.
createAPool.nativeAssetWarning: Your ETH/WETH balance may not be sufficient for seed this pool and may cause pool funding to fail. You can adjust whether you use ETH or WETH for seed liquidity in the previous step.
createAPool.recommendedLiquidity: It’s recommended to provide new pools with at least $20,000 in initial funds
createAPool.recoveredStateInfo: Your previously left before creating this pool. Your choices have been saved so you can continue from before.
createAPool.setAnAddress: Set an address to control fees
createAPool.swapFeeSuggestion: 0.30% is best for most weighted pools with established tokens. Go higher for more exotic pairs.
createAPool.title: Create a pool
createAPool.totalWeightAlert: The total weighting of all tokens must equal exactly 100% before you can proceed.
createAPool.unknownTokenPriceAlert: We couldn't find prices for one or more tokens you have chosen ({0}).
createAPool.unknownTokenPriceWarning: Our pricing partner, CoinGecko, does not recognize {0}. This leaves you vulnerable to losing money to arbitraguers, if you don’t add pool assets in proportion to their target weights. To be warned of potential losses, enter the current price of this asset.
createAPool.youCanFundWithThisPoolWith: Based on your wallet balances for these tokens, the maximum amount you can fund this pool with is ~{0}.
createAPool.zeroWeightTitle: You’ve included a token with zero weight
createAPool.zeroWeightInfo: All tokens in a pool must have a weighting greater than zero. Either remove or replace {0} or set it above 0.01%.

whyMigrate.title: Why migrate?
whyMigrate.description: Boosted pools also earn additional yield from holding interest-bearing aTokens. aTokens accrue interest in real time when underlying assets are loaned out to borrowers on Aave.

whyMigrate.title: Why migrate?
whyMigrate.description: Boosted pools also earn additional yield from holding interest-bearing aTokens. aTokens accrue interest in real time when underlying assets are loaned out to borrowers on Aave.

migrateReason.title: Migrate to avoid vulnerability
migrateReason.description: A security vulnerability was recently disclosed. Although, no funds are a risk, insofar as the exploit could only be executed by pool owners or Balancer Governance itself which is composed of known participants in the Balancer ecosystem, it is recommended to migrate your funds asap.

whyMigrate.title: Why migrate?
whyMigrate.description: Boosted pools also earn additional yield from holding interest-bearing aTokens. aTokens accrue interest in real time when underlying assets are loaned out to borrowers on Aave.

poolInfo.stakedUnstaked: You have both unstaked and staked liquidity in this pool. You can migrate both or just one.

riskWarnings.title: Some risks - you may lose funds in the pool if:

risks.loseUSDPeg: Any of the tokens in this pool permanently loses it's target peg of 1 USD.
risks.aaveStableExploit: Problems arise on Aave. This is because, most of the stablecoins will be invested into Aave aTokens to earn you additional yield.

previewModal.priceImpactAccept: I accept the high price impact from pool migration.

errorLoadingMigration.title: Something went wrong
errorLoadingMigration.description: An error occurred while trying to show pool migration.

tooltips.totalTo: The total value of your pool tokens in USD that you'll be migrating
tooltips.newTotal: The total value in USD that you'll get into the migrated pool

creator: Creator
customAmountsTip: Adding custom amounts causes the internal prices of the pool to change, as if you were swapping tokens. The higher the price impact the more you'll spend in swap fees.
delegateFeesTooltip: Liquidity providers in this pool earn fixed swap fees on every swap utilizing the liquidity in this pool. Control has been delegated to the community, so fees could change in the future if this pool becomes actively managed.
deprecatedPool: This pool has been deprecated. If you're a Liquidity Provider, please migrate to the new upgraded pool.
errorNoLists: Sorry, we can't find any lists
errorNoMatch: Sorry, we can't find any matches
errorNoTokens: Sorry, we can't find any tokens
ethBufferInstruction:
This pool requires Wrapped Ether (WETH). To maximize your
liquidity provision, you could wrap some additional ETH. Make sure to keep
enough ETH to cover gas costs.
ethereumTxTypeTooltip: Most users will want EIP-1559 Transactions, but there are some instances that may require a Legacy Transaction. For example, some Ledger users have had issues using MetaMask with EIP-1559 Transactions.
exceedsPoolBalance: Exceeds pool balance for this token

featuredProtocols.title: Featured ecosystem protocols
featuredProtocols.Copper: Copper offers an intuitive UI for creating, managing & tracking Balancer Liquidity Bootstrapping Pools (LBPs) on a transparent and user-friendly platform.
featuredProtocols.Element: An open source protocol for fixed & variable yield markets, Element enables efficient swaps with a Balancer Pool that minimizes slippage and impermanent loss.
featuredProtocols.Sense: Sense is a protocol for DeFi yield primitives, and Sense Space, an AMM built on Balancer, facilitates efficient swaps between yield and principle tokens.
featuredProtocols.Tracer: An open-source protocol for derivative markets, Tracer DAO utilizes Balancer Protocol for aggregated liquidity and creating a market for leveraged tokens.

feesManagedByGauntlet: Liquidity providers earn dynamic swap fees on every swap utilizing the liquidity in this pool. Dynamic swap fees are controlled by governance and are currently set by Gauntlet.
finishCreatingPoolAlert: You last left before finishing creating and seeding a pool.
finishSeedingPoolAlert: Finish initializing the pool you just created by seeding it with liquidity
fixedFeesTooltip: Liquidity providers in this pool earn fixed swap fees on every swap that utilizes the liquidity in this pool.
fundPoolTooltip: Add the initial liquidity for this pool.

lowAmount.header: Your swap amount is too low
lowAmount.body: The fees for this transaction exceed the amount you want to swap.

lowBalance.body: The fees and potential slippage (up to {2}) set for this swap exceed your {0} balance. You need at least {1} {0} to proceed.

highFees.body: You can still proceed with the swap but a high percentage of it will be consumed by swap fees.
highFees.header: The fees on this transaction exceed 20% of the swap amount.

goToBalancerV1Site: Go to the Balancer V1 site ->
highPriceImpactDetailed: This swap is significantly moving the market price.
highRiskPool: This is a higher-risk pool that contains one or more unlisted tokens. A liquidity pool is only as good as its weakest token! If a token were blacklisted, infinitely minted, frozen, or exploited in any other way, the value of this pool could go to 0. Balancer Foundation is never liable for losses incurred through using our UI or the Balancer protocol. Be careful, and do your own research!
insufficientBalanceDetailed: This swap requires more funds than you have in your wallet.
insufficientLiquidityDetailed: Try swapping with a smaller amount or check back when liquidity for this pool has increased.
invalidFeeExplain: Please enter a valid fee between 0.0001% and 10%

tooltips.approval: You must approve {0} to add liquidity for this token on Balancer. Approvals are required once per token, per wallet.

managedPoolTradingHalted.description: A swapping halt has been issued by the manager of this pool. For your safety, while the swapping halt is in effect, you may only add liquidity in proportional amounts.
managedPoolTradingHalted.title: Swapping halted - proportional liquidity provision only

lowLiquidity.description: Add assets proportionally to the pool weights or the price impact will be high and you will likely get REKT and lose money.
lowLiquidity.title: Be careful: This pool has low liquidity

rektPriceImpact.description: The likelihood of you losing money is too high. For your protection, you can’t perform this transaction on this interface.
rektPriceImpact.title: This price impact is too high. You cannot proceed

investmentPoolsAbout: Stake your assets to get $BAL tokens for participating in Balancer V2 liquidity mining.
investmentSuccess: Your tokens have been added to this pool, and you have received a new LP token representing this action.
investmentTooltip: Confirm your liquidity add into this pool
liquidityMiningIncentivesCopy: Liquidity incentives on {0} are paused for 1 week during its upgrade to the veBAL system. Incentives will resume on April 28.

liquidityMiningPopover.airdropEligibility: People who provide liquidity to eligible pools or swap on eligible token pairs receive weekly $BAL distributions as incentives. $BAL token holders own the Balancer Protocol and can help shape its future by voting on governance proposals.
liquidityMiningPopover.airdropExplainer: Weekly distributions from liquidity mining on {0} are airdropped on Wednesdays, sent directly to your wallet using disperse.app

claimFreezeWarning.description: Since you have several weeks' worth of tokens unclaimed, your screen may appear to freeze after pressing the claim button while it is processed. Just leave your browser open and your wallet will eventually pop open for you to complete the claim.
claimFreezeWarning.title: Too many claims

liquidityMiningPopover.networksExplainer: Switch networks in the header to see your current cumulative $BAL incentives on {0} and {1}.

noRewards.description: Certain eligible pools have ‘liquidity mining’ token incentives which are distributed to investors weekly in proportion to their contribution.
noRewards.title: You have no token incentives to claim

liquidityMiningPopover.title: Token incentives

liquidityProviderCopy: People who provide liquidity to eligible pools or swap on eligible token pairs receive weekly $BAL distributions as incentives. $BAL token holders own the Balancer Protocol and can help shape its future by voting on governance proposals.

locking.expiredLockTooltip: Your previous locking period has expired, so you no longer have any veBAL or voting power. You will no longer earn protocol fees, boosted yields on staked Ethereum Mainnet pools or veBAL incentives. However, you'll still get the minimum 1.0x rate. Redeem your expired locked B-80BAL-20WETH LP tokens and then create a new lock to get veBAL.
locking.lockedLpTokensTooltip: The USD value of your veBAL. These are your locked LP tokens in the BAL 80% / WETH 20% pool.
locking.unlockedLpTokensTooltip: The USD value of your liquidity provided to the BAL 80% / WETH 20% pool that has not been locked.

marketConditionsWarning: Market conditions may change between the time your order is submitted and the time it gets executed on Ethereum. Slippage tolerance is the maximum change in price you are willing to accept. This protects you from front-running bots and miner extractable value (MEV).
minTransactionBuffer: To ensure a smooth transaction, at least {0} {1} must be left in your wallet to pay for gas fees.
missingPoolNameOrSymbolInfo: There is a missing pool name or symbol, fill it in before creating the pool.

veBalRedirectModal.title: Proceed to mainnet
veBalRedirectModal.description:
Getting and using veBAL to vest and vote must be performed on the Ethereum mainnet. 

 You can still earn liquidity mining incentives on Arbitrum and Polygon by adding liquidty to eligible pools. However to vote to direct emissions to your favored pools and to earn the protocol fees, you will need to use veBAL on Ethereum Mainnet by locking B-80BAL-20WETH.

claim.title: Claim your liquidity mining incentives
claim.description: Incentives to attract liquidity are set by the Balancer protocol and partners. Stakers in eligible pools can claim incentives every block. People with veBAL get a boosted rate—up to 2.5x extra.

pastEarnings.title: Past earnings
pastEarnings.description: This contract was deprecated on 25 July 2022. Any earnings after this date will be distributed by the upgraded contract.

policies.balancerThirdPartyInfo: Balancer is an open source, permissionless, decentralized protocol. The smart contracts that power the ecosystem may be used by anyone. This website is the Balancer Foundation's front-end to the ecosystem and it is also open-source. You are free to fork it on Github and modify it as you wish

tooltips.nativeAssetSelection: Select {0} or {1} to add liquidity to this pool. Wrap or unwrap {0} to maximize your liquidity provision.

bugWarning20220513.title: This pool contains double-entrypoint tokens, which have been found to be incompatible with Balancer. It is currently not possible to withdraw all assets from the pool proportionally. While it is possible to withdraw in a single asset, liquidity providers are advised to wait. A mechanism is being implemented to allow for proportional withdrawals. Learn more

poolOwnerVulnWarningGovernanceMigrate.title: This pool is affected by a vulnerability disclosed here. You're advised to migrate your liquidity.

poolOwnerVulnWarningEcosystem.title: This pool is affected by a vulnerability disclosed here. Reach out on Discord if you need help creating a new pool with the same composition.

poolOwnerVulnWarningEcosystemMigrate.title: This pool is affected by a vulnerability disclosed here. You're advised to migrate your liquidity.

services.infura: Used to fetch on-chain data and constructs contract calls with an Infura API.
services.alchemy: Used to fetch on-chain data and constructs contract calls with an Alchemy API.
services.the-graph: Used to fetch blockchain data from The Graph’s hosted service.
services.fathom-analytics: Used to understand user behavior on the site and marketing performance.
services.TRM-labs: Used to securely collect wallet addresses and shares it with TRM Labs Inc. for risk and compliance reasons.
services.sentry: Used for error tracking and performance monitoring.

setUpEthereumWallet: Balancer is a DeFi app on Ethereum. Set up an Ethereum Wallet to swap and provide liquidity here.

staking.potentialWeeklyEarningTooltip: The approximate weekly earning based on your staked balance
staking.stakedLpTokensTooltip: The fiat value of LP tokens you have staked in this pool.
staking.stakeValueTooltip: The approximate value of the LP tokens you will stake.

staking.restakeGauge: Restake to receive future liquidity mining incentives
staking.restakeGaugeDescription: You’re staking against a pool gauge which is being deactivated on 21 September 2022. Restake to the new gauge for this pool to receive future liquidity mining incentives.

staking.unstakeValueTooltip: The approximate value of the LP tokens you will unstake.

staking.restakeTooltip: Confirm unstaking of LP tokens. You'll be able to restake to earn liquidity mining incentives for this pool.

benefits.earn: Earn your share of protocol revenue
benefits.boost: Boost liquidity mining yield up to 2.5x
benefits.vote: Vote to direct liquidity mining emissions

tokenInfo.balWETH: Add liquidity to the 80% BAL / 20% WETH pool to get the B-80BAL-20WETH LP token.
tokenInfo.lpToken: Lock up the LP tokens from the 80% BAL / 20% WETH pool for up to a year to get veBAL. The longer you lock, the more veBAL you get.
tokenInfo.veBAL: Use veBAL to earn extra on your staked pools. Only some pools are eligible for staking. Check any pools that you are in, and stake it to earn liquidity mining incentives. You can also use veBAL to vote to direct future liquidity mining emissions

cards.myExpiredLockTooltip: Your previous lockup period has expired, so you no longer have any veBAL or voting power. You will no longer earn protocol fees, boosted yields on staked Ethereum Mainnet pools or veBAL incentives. However, you’ll still get the minimum 1.0x rate. Tap the minus icon to redeem your expired locked B-80BAL-20WETH LP tokens and then create a new lock to get veBAL.

liquidityMining.title: Pools eligible for liquidity mining
liquidityMining.description: Liquidity incentives are directed by the community of veBAL holders. If you hold veBAL, vote below on any pools across Ethereum and Layer 2’s. Your vote will persist until you change it and editing a pool can only be done once in 10 days.
liquidityMining.myUnallocatedVotesTooltip: veBAL holders can vote for a single pool or multiple pools in whatever weights they choose, up to their max of 100%. Note: If you’ve previously voted for a pool but no longer have any veBAL, your votes will not count.
liquidityMining.votingPeriodTooltip: There is a weekly vote for veBAL holders which ends at 0:00 UTC on Thursdays. This vote determines the BAL incentives allocation for all Stakers in these pools for the next week. Although you don’t have to vote to get a boosted yield, your vote can help you earn more by voting on pools where you are a staker.
liquidityMining.votingPowerExpiredTooltip: Your previous lock period has expired, so you no longer have any veBAL or voting power. Any votes that have been allocated in the past will no longer count. Lock up B-80BAL-20WETH LP tokens to get veBAL for higher yields and voting power.

limitsTooltip.distributionsCappedVeBAL: Distributions to the veBAL gauge are capped at 10%
limitsTooltip.distributionsCappedAt: Distributions to this gauge are capped at {0}%

popover.emissionsInfo: Your vote directs future liquidity mining emissions starting from the next period on Thursday at 0:00 UTC.
popover.remainingVotesEditing: Your remaining votes: {0} ({1} current allocation in this pool + {2} unallocated votes)
popover.remainingVotesExceeded: This exceeds your remaining votes of: {0}
popover.resubmitVote: Voting power is set at the time of the vote. If you get more veBAL later, resubmit your vote to use your increased power.
popover.voteLockInfo: Votes are timelocked for 10 days. If you vote now, no edits can be made until {0}.

votedTooRecently.title: Votes are locked for 10 days
votedTooRecently.description: You won't be able to make any edits to this vote allocation for {0}

noVeBal.title: You need some veBAL to vote on gauges
noVeBal.description: Get veBAL by locking up LP tokens from the 80% BAL / 20% WETH pool.
noVeBal.inputHintText: You can't vote since you have no veBAL

veBalLockTooShort.title: veBAL not locked for 7 days
veBalLockTooShort.description: You must have veBAL locked for more than 7 days to vote on gauges.

veBalVoteOverLimitWarning.title: You may be wasting your vote: veBAL cap hit
veBalVoteOverLimitWarning.description: Distributions to veBAL holders of weekly emissions are capped at 10%. Any votes exceeding this amount at Thursday 0:00 UTC will not be counted.

lpVoteOverLimitWarning.title: You may be wasting your vote
lpVoteOverLimitWarning.description: Distributions to LPs of this pool gauge are capped at {0}%. Any votes exceeding this amount at Thursday 0:00 UTC will not be counted.

notSupported.title: Locking is unavailable on this network

veBAL.votingTransitionDescription: Liquidity mining emissions as directed by veBAL holders start on 7 April 2022 at 0:00 UTC! Voting is now live, so get veBAL and vote for pools. Your vote will persist until you edit. Editing can only be done once in 10 days.

steps.lock: Lock-up the resulting LP token ({0}). The longer you lock (1 year max), the more veBAL you get.

earn.boost: veBAL holders get boosted liquidity mining yields (up to 2.5x) and increased voting power.
earn.voting: Use this voting power to choose which pool gauges get allocated liquidity mining incentives. Vote on the pools where you have added liquidity to earn more yield.

lockAmount.title: How much do you want to lock?

lockEndDate.title: Lock until
lockEndDate.tooltip: The longer you lock your stake, the more veBAL voting power you get (up to 4 years). You can extend the lock later. Be careful, locking is not reversible.

totalVotingEscrowTooltip.explainer: Lock-up end dates can only be on Thursdays at 0:00 UTC. To get as close as possible to a 1 year lock, locking on Thursday is recommended.

notSupported.title: Locking is unavailable on this network
Unlocking is unavailable on this network

tableShowsBalancerV2Pools: This table shows only Balancer V2 pools.
tokenWarning: Balancer Foundation is not liable for any losses you might incur as a direct or indirect result of adding liquidity to this pool. Do not add deflationary tokens, tokens with transfer fees, or any other non-ERC20-conforming tokens. Please acknowlege before continuing.
tokenWarningTitle: You have added a custom token

addLiquidity.priceImpact: Price impact from adding liquidity results when the value of each token added is not proportional to the weights of the pool. Adding non-proportional amounts causes the internal prices of the pool to change, as if you were swapping tokens. The higher the price impact, the worse price you’ll get to enter your position.
addLiquidity.total: The total value in {0} you’ll be adding into this pool.

withdraw.priceImpact: Price impact from removing liquidity results when the value of each token removed is not proportional to the weights of the pool. Removing non-proportional amounts causes the internal prices of the pool to change, as if you were swapping tokens. The higher the price impact, the worse price you’ll get for exiting your position.
withdraw.total: The total value in {0} you’ll be withdrawing from this pool.

disabledTooltip.eth: This option is disabled because gasless swaps only work with ERC-20 tokens. 'ETH' is not an ERC-20 token.
disabledTooltip.wrapUnwrap: This option has been disabled because Wrap/Unwrap transactions always require a gas transaction.

tradeGaslessToggle.label: Swap gasless
tradeGaslessToggle.tooltip: ‘Swap gasless’ on the Balancer CoW Protocol for free signature swaps, MEV protection, and the best prices with intelligent swap routing across DeFi exchanges. Turn it off to swap only through Balancer liquidity pools using gas.

tradesThroughWeth: Swaps from ETH route through Balancer liquidity pools and incur gas fees.

exactOut.title: Swap to {0} details

sign.content: Upon your signature, the Balancer CoW Protocol will find an optimal route amongst other swappers or from liquidity on other DeFi exchanges, with MEV protection.

trade.content: Finalize the transaction by submitting it for inclusion on the blockchain.
trade.title: Confirm transaction

tradeToggle.signature: Signature ‘gasless’ swap—price optimized with MEV protection.

transactionDeadlineTooltip: Your swap will expire and not execute if it is pending for more than the selected duration. Only executed transactions incur fees for swaps between ERC-20 tokens.

gasTooLow.title: Gas too low
gasTooLow.description: Transaction gas is too low. There is not enough gas to cover minimal cost of the transaction. Try increasing supplied gas.

cannotEstGas.title: Cannot estimate gas
cannotEstGas.description: Transaction may fail or require manual gas limit.

slippage.title: Transaction failed due to slippage
slippage.description: The market price changed beyond your slippage tolerance due to other trades processed before yours. Try again or increase your slippage tolerance.

transactionPending: No transactions pending | 1 transaction pending | {n} transactions pending
unavailableOnNetwork: Sorry! Balancer is not available on this network
unavailableOnNetworkWithName: Sorry! Balancer is not available on {0}
viewAndManangeOnElement: View and manage all pools on Element.fi
whichPools: Which liquidity pools should be used when you make a swap.

tooltips.priceImpact: Withdrawing custom amounts causes the internal prices of the pool to change, as if you were swapping tokens. The higher the price impact the more you'll spend in swap fees.

errors.SINGLE_ASSET_WITHDRAWAL_MIN_BPT_LIMIT: You can only withdraw 30% of the pool's value in single asset withdrawals

withdrawalSuccess: Your liquidity has been withdrawn from this pool, and the underlying tokens are now in your wallet.
withdrawWarning: Withdrawing single asset amounts causes the internal prices of the pool to change, as if you were swapping tokens. The higher the price impact the more you'll spend in swap fees.
wrapStEthTooltip: This pool requires Wrapped Liquid Staked ETH 2.0 (wstETH). To maximize your liquidity provision, you could wrap some additional stETH.

poolAttrs.feesEditableGovernance: this may be edited via Governance
poolAttrs.feesEditableOwner: this may be edited by the Pool Owner
poolAttrs.immutable: This pool is immutable. No attributes can ever be changed.
poolAttrs.immutableFeesEditableByGovernance: The attributes of this pool are immutable, except for swap fees which can be edited via Governance.
poolAttrs.immutableFeesEditableByOwner: The attributes of this pool are immutable, except for swap fees which can be edited by the Pool Owner.
